text: The 1988–89 Algerian Championnat National was the 27th season of the Algerian Championnat National since its establishment in 1962. A total of 16 teams contested the league, with Mouloudia d'Oran as the defending champions, The Championnat started on September 22, 1988. and ended on June 1, 1989. ==Team summaries== === Promotion and relegation === Teams promoted from Algerian Division 2 1988–1989 * Entente de Sétif * Jeunesse de Belcourt Teams relegated to Algerian Division 2 1989–1990 * Union d'Aïn Béïda * Entente de Collo ==League table== ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Pos. !Player !Club !Goals |- |rowspan=1 align="center"|1 | Chawki Bentayeb | Union d'Aïn Béïda |rowspan=1 align="center"|19 |- |rowspan=1 align="center"|2 | Nacer Bouiche | JS Tizi Ouzou |rowspan=1 align="center"|18 |- |rowspan=2 align="center"|3 | Chelaoua | Rapid de Relizane |rowspan=2 align="center"|11 |- | Driss | MO Constantine |- |rowspan=3 align="center"|5 | Mohamed Benabou | Rapid de Relizane |rowspan=3 align="center"|10 |- | El Groud | MO Constantine |- | Mourad Meziane | Mouloudia d'Oran |- |rowspan=2 align="center"|8 | Menni | US Bel-Abbès |rowspan=2 align="center"|9 |- | Belaouchet | Mouloudia d'Alger |- |rowspan=3 align="center"|10 | Tlemcani | US Bel-Abbès |rowspan=3 align="center"|8 |- | Meguenni | Association d'Oran |- | Zeggour | Jeunesse de Bordj Menaïel |- |rowspan=5 align="center"|13 | Hamada | RS Kouba |rowspan=5 align="center"|7 |- | Tarek Hadj Adlane | Union d'Alger |- | Omrani | JS Tizi Ouzou |- | Amokrane | Union d'Aïn Béïda |- | T.Bouali | Espérance d'Aïn M'lila |} ==References== ==External links== *1988–89 Algerian Championnat National Algerian Championnat National Championnat National Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 seasons
